Paul,

This looks really fun and exciting.  It'll likely be several days be=
fore I
can take a look, but I'm hoping others will take the time.  Thanks!
=

   David


On Wed, Jan 9, 2013 at 9:55 PM, Paul Holser <pholser@...>=
 wrote:

> **
>
>
> Hi JUnit,
>
> I've been working on junit-quickcheck (
>=
 https://github.com/pholser/junit-quickcheck) on and off for a while now,
>=
 and wanted to solicit some feedback from potential users.
>
> junit-quickc=
heck uses the ParameterSupplier extension point of JUnit's
> Theories runne=
r to feed a number of randomly generated values to a @Theory
> method, as o=
pposed to prescribing @DataPoint(s). As its name suggests, it
> draws inspi=
ration from the Haskell QuickCheck library (
> http://www.cse.chalmers.se/~=
rjmh/QuickCheck/).
>
> Though the project is built with Maven, none of the =
artifacts it produces
> are deployed to a central Maven repo (yet). Some of=
 its dependencies are
> still snapshot versions: they can be found here:
>
=
> -- https://github.com/pholser/junit.contrib
>
> The 'theories' module of =
junit.contrib contains a version of the Theories
> runner that should be cu=
rrent with the JUnit 4.11 implementation, but:
> 1) better handles theory p=
arameters involving generics
> 2) uses the Paranamer (http://paranamer.code=
haus.org/) library to allow
> ParameterSignatures to carry a parameter's na=
me
> 3) is packaged as org.junit.contrib.theories.*... rather than
> org.ju=
nit.experimental.theories.*...
>
> This is the Theories runner that junit-q=
uickcheck tests use. It in turn
> depends on:
>
> -- https://github.com/pho=
lser/paranamer
>
> If you choose to build junit-quickcheck, you'll need to =
build these
> dependencies too.
>
> I'm interested in any and all feedback,=
 but am particularly interested in
> these items:
>
> -- Would size control=
 be useful (e.g. maxSize on @ForAll)? Maybe size()
> gets computed on every=
 generation, as with Haskell QuickCheck?
> -- Do we need different random d=
istributions/@Frequency?
> -- What other basic generator configs would be u=
seful?
> -- What other out-of-the-box generators would be useful?
> -- Is t=
he behavior of the out-of-the-box generators sufficient? What
> should be c=
hanged, if anything?
> -- nextLong(min, max) and nextDouble(min, max) -- ge=
tting them to span the
> entire range.
> -- Is @SuchThat with OGNL and Para=
namer useful, or cute but not that
> helpful? What about without Paranamer?=

>
> Feel free to check this project out, and drop me an email or post issu=
es
> to the project's GitHub site. Thanks for your time!
>
> Regards,
> Pau=
l Holser
>
>  
>
